parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

word: that we should not cause trouble for
str2: To trouble, cause disturbance to, annoy, harass. From para and enochleo; to harass further, i.e. Annoy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
